chess

Class Bishop

  • java.lang.Object
    • chess.ChessPiece
      • chess.Bishop

  • public class Bishop
extends ChessPiece
    Bishop is the subclass of ChessPiece that houses the logic for bishops moving. It uses the boolean variables hoizontalPos and verticlePos to determine in what direction the piece is trying to move. Afterward it tests all valid moves in that direction until it hits an obstacle (enemy piece in the way, edge of board) or finds the desired location.
    Author:
    Scott Lahart, Niles Ball

    • Method Detail

      • isValidMove

        public boolean isValidMove(int startRow,
                           int startCol,
                           int endRow,
                           int endCol,
                           ChessPiece[][] board)
        isValidMove for bishop checks in what diagonal direction the piece is trying to move. It then tests every board location in that direction, stopping if it reaches the edge of the board, an enemy piece gets in its way, or it finds its target
        Specified by:
        isValidMove in class ChessPiece
        Parameters:
        startRow - startRow is the row of the piece being tested
        startCol - startCol is the column of the piece being tested
        endRow - endRow is the row of the space attempting to be moved to
        endCol - endCol is the column of the space attempting to be moved to
        board - board is the 8x8 chessboard housing all the pieces. This is passed to check for things such as friendly pieces being in the end location, or enemy pieces being in the path of the move.
        Returns:
        isValidMove returns true if the move is acceptable, or false if it breaks the rules

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        This is the toString override. Bishops print a lowercase 'w' or 'b' depending on their color, followed by a capital 'B'
        Overrides:
        toString in class ChessPiece
